intro: Taraxacum schroeterianum, commonly known as the Schröter's dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems bear a single, yellow composite flower that develops into a spherical seed head. Taraxacum schroeterianum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
